intro: Bufonia stricta subsp. cecconiana, commonly known as the narrowleaf bufonia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy fruits. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
